column4: ---Who knows how I can message a cellular phone using a Linux program?
Randomusr_: Yes, but it costs money
yeah google works well for that but not all providers/countries are covered
Verizon USA.
yup and I do it from google mail
Can I use it with Empathy?
don't think so
Google Talk work?
try it :)
Cross your fingers, I'm at my wit's end...
won't authenticate.
No matter what I do it's not authenticating. No proxy, I tried CloudLevi, CloudLevi@Live.com, and CloudLevi@gmail.com ...nothing
edit your contacts info in gmail and add the phone number then when you click on the persons name in your contact list it will give you an option to SMS. This is all offtopic for this channel btw
don't know what to tell you
your attitude in here will determine the type of support you get :) We get that you are frustrated but that is not going to get you anywhere.
ok so you don't want to use the official ubuntu guide but you will take advice from total random strangers ina chatroom?
I suggest you take the advice of the users in here and calm down.
I can't promise that because I have no clue if you will follow the guide
Stop YELLING at me
are you also running compiz at the same time?
ok guess not :)
try disabling the desktop effects in System > Appearances menu then run tremulous to see if it improves
